userStories.title: Project Foundation & Next.js Setup
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js 14+ project initialized with App Router and TypeScript
Tailwind CSS configured with custom design system (colors, fonts, spacing)
ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript strict mode configured
Project runs with 'npm run dev' without errors
userStories.notes: Foundation - Week 1. Sets up the base Next.js project with all tooling.

userStories.title: Database Setup & Prisma Schema
acceptanceCriteria: Prisma ORM initialized with complete schema for all 13 tables
Tables: users, accounts, workspaces, workspace_members, forms, form_fields, form_screens, responses, response_answers, themes, webhooks, webhook_logs
All foreign key relationships defined correctly
Prisma client singleton created in src/lib/prisma.ts
Database schema matches spec.md Section 2.2 exactly
userStories.notes: Foundation - Week 1. Critical database schema that all features depend on.

userStories.title: NextAuth.js Authentication System
acceptanceCriteria: Email/password provider working with bcrypt hashing (12+ rounds)
Google OAuth provider integrated and functional
GitHub OAuth provider integrated and functional
Session management working with secure tokens
Protected route middleware implemented in middleware.ts
Users can sign up with email/password
Sessions persist correctly across page refreshes
userStories.notes: Foundation - Week 2. Core authentication before any feature work.

userStories.title: Email Service & Verification Flow
acceptanceCriteria: Email templates created for verification and password reset
Password reset emails sent on request
Password reset links work correctly and expire after use
Email sending utility created in src/lib/email.ts
userStories.notes: Foundation - Week 2. Completes authentication system with email flows.

userStories.title: Authentication UI Pages
acceptanceCriteria: All auth forms have proper validation
Redirect to dashboard after successful login
userStories.notes: Foundation - Week 2. UI for authentication flows.

userStories.title: UI Component Library
acceptanceCriteria: Components: Button, Input, Textarea, Select, Checkbox, Radio, Switch, Label
Components: Card, Badge, Avatar, Tooltip, Table, Modal, Toast
Components: Sidebar, Tabs, Alert, Loading Spinner, Progress Bar
Components: DatePicker, ColorPicker, FileUpload, Dropdown Menu
Keyboard navigation works for all interactive elements
Design system matches spec.md Section 14 (colors, typography, spacing)
userStories.notes: Week 3. Reusable component library needed before building features.

userStories.title: Workspace Creation & Management
acceptanceCriteria: API routes: POST /api/workspaces, GET /api/workspaces, PATCH /api/workspaces/[id], DELETE /api/workspaces/[id]
Users can create workspaces with name and auto-generated slug
Default workspace auto-created on user signup
Dashboard layout created with sidebar navigation
userStories.notes: Week 4. Multi-tenant workspace foundation.

userStories.title: Workspace Member Management & RBAC
acceptanceCriteria: Workspace member model and role system implemented
Roles: owner, admin, editor, viewer with correct permissions
API routes for member management: GET/POST/PATCH/DELETE /api/workspaces/[id]/members
Invitation emails sent with accept/decline links
Pending invitations list visible in settings
UI shows member list with roles and actions
userStories.notes: Week 4. Role-based access control for team collaboration.

userStories.title: Form Builder UI - Three Panel Layout
acceptanceCriteria: Three-panel layout implemented: fields palette (left), preview (center), settings (right)
Zustand store created for form builder state
userStories.notes: Week 5. Core form builder interface before adding field types.

userStories.title: Form Builder - Basic Question Types (6 types)
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript discriminated union type system for all field types
Form fields model in Prisma with JSONB properties
Short Text field type with placeholder, max length, default value
Long Text field type with auto-resize textarea
Number field type with min/max values and decimal places
Multiple Choice field type with add/remove/reorder options
Checkboxes field type with min/max selections
Each field type has builder component and settings panel
Fields can be added from palette
Fields can be reordered via drag-drop
Field settings panel updates based on selected field
userStories.notes: Week 5-6. First 6 question types to validate form builder architecture.

userStories.title: Form Builder - Extended Question Types (12 types)
acceptanceCriteria: Dropdown field type with searchable options
Yes/No field type with custom labels
Rating Scale field type (1-5 or 1-10 stars)
Opinion Scale field type (0-10 linear scale)
Date field type with date picker and min/max range
Phone Number field type with country code selector
Website URL field type with validation
Legal Consent field type with checkbox and legal text
File Upload field type with S3/Vercel Blob integration
Ranking field type with drag-drop reordering
Matrix/Grid field type with rows and columns
Presigned URL generation for secure uploads
All field types have complete settings panels
All 18 field types working in form builder
userStories.notes: Week 7. Completes all question types. File upload needs external storage setup.

userStories.title: Field Validation System
acceptanceCriteria: Min/max length validation for text fields
Min/max value validation for number fields
Validation configuration UI in settings panel
Validation errors display clearly to respondents
userStories.notes: Week 6-7. Validation system for all field types.

userStories.title: Welcome & Thank You Screens
acceptanceCriteria: Form screens model in Prisma (welcome, thank_you)
Welcome screen configuration UI in form builder
Thank you screen configuration UI in form builder
Welcome screen: custom title, description, button text
Thank you screen: custom title, description, redirect URL
Rich text formatting for screen descriptions
Social share buttons option for thank you screen
userStories.notes: Week 8. Screens that bookend the form experience.

userStories.title: Form Publishing & Public Routes
acceptanceCriteria: Published forms accessible via public URL
Forms can be cloned with all fields and settings
Public form URL displayed after publishing
Copy link button for easy sharing
QR code generation for form URL
userStories.notes: Week 8. Publishing system to make forms accessible.

userStories.title: Form Rendering Engine - One Question at a Time
acceptanceCriteria: Form rendering engine built in src/components/form-renderer/
One question displayed at a time (Typeform signature UX)
Smooth transitions between questions using Framer Motion
All 18 field types render correctly for respondents
Thank you screen displays after submission
Navigation: Next/Back buttons, Enter key to continue
Mobile responsive - works perfectly on phones/tablets
userStories.notes: Week 9. Core respondent experience - most important user-facing feature.

userStories.title: Response Submission & Storage
acceptanceCriteria: Response and response_answers models in Prisma
Response metadata captured: IP, user agent, timestamps
Answers stored in response_answers with JSONB values
File uploads stored as URLs in file_urls array
Submission success redirects to thank you screen or URL
userStories.notes: Week 9. Response collection and storage system.

userStories.title: Logic Jumps - Conditional Branching
acceptanceCriteria: Logic jump data structure designed (JSONB in form_fields.logic_jumps)
Condition builder UI in form builder
Condition types: equals, not_equals, contains, greater_than, less_than, is_selected, is_empty
AND/OR logic support for multiple conditions
Actions: jump to specific question, skip to end
Logic jumps execute correctly during form taking
userStories.notes: Week 10. Complex conditional logic for dynamic forms.

userStories.title: Response Management - List & Detail Views
acceptanceCriteria: Paginated table view of all responses
Table columns: submission date, completion time, status
Individual response detail view with all Q&A
Submission metadata displayed (time taken, IP, user agent)
userStories.notes: Week 11. Response viewing and management.

userStories.title: Response Filtering, Search & Export
acceptanceCriteria: Sort by any column (date, time, status)
Export includes all fields and metadata
Download triggers immediately with correct filename
userStories.notes: Week 11. Advanced response management features.

userStories.title: Response Analytics Dashboard
acceptanceCriteria: Per-question analytics: multiple choice percentage breakdown (pie chart)
Charts render correctly using chart library
Analytics update in real-time when new responses arrive
userStories.notes: Week 11. Basic analytics to provide insights.

userStories.title: Theme System - Editor & Customization
acceptanceCriteria: Theme model in Prisma with JSONB for colors, fonts, background, layout
Theme library page listing all themes
Color customization: primary, background, text, button text, error, success
Typography controls: question font, answer font, button font
Background customization: solid color, gradient, image upload
Layout options: alignment, container width, spacing
userStories.notes: Week 12. Comprehensive theme customization system.

userStories.title: Theme Application to Public Forms
acceptanceCriteria: CSS variables injected based on theme settings
Public forms render with applied theme
Colors apply correctly (primary, background, text, etc.)
Theme changes preview in real-time in builder
Default theme applied if no custom theme
userStories.notes: Week 12. Theme application to make forms visually customized.

userStories.title: Form Settings - General & Access Control
acceptanceCriteria: Tabbed interface: General, Access, Notifications, Integrations
General tab: form title, description, custom URL slug, language
Access control: publish/unpublish toggle, accept responses toggle
Access control enforcement on public form submission
Password prompt on public form if protected
Form shows 'closed' message when limit reached or date passed
userStories.notes: Week 13. Form configuration and access control.

userStories.title: Email Notifications for Responses
acceptanceCriteria: Notification settings tab in form settings
Email notification sent when response submitted
Emails include form name and response summary
Email sending triggered via webhook or background job
userStories.notes: Week 13. Email notification system for responses.

userStories.title: Form Response Options & Behavior
acceptanceCriteria: Response options tab in form settings
Allow multiple responses per user toggle
Thank you options: redirect URL, show response summary
Settings apply correctly on public forms
Back button appears if navigation enabled
userStories.notes: Week 13. Response behavior configuration.

userStories.title: Webhook System - Configuration & Delivery
acceptanceCriteria: Webhook configuration UI for adding URL and events
Webhook secret generation for HMAC signature
Retry logic with exponential backoff (3 attempts)
Background job processing for webhook delivery
userStories.notes: Week 14. Webhook integration for external services.

userStories.title: Webhook Logging & Monitoring
acceptanceCriteria: Webhook logs page showing all delivery attempts
Logs display: status (success/failed), timestamp, status code
Request body and response body logged
Error messages logged for failed attempts
Recent logs visible in webhook settings
userStories.notes: Week 14. Webhook monitoring and debugging.

userStories.title: Keyboard Shortcuts & Undo/Redo
acceptanceCriteria: Arrow keys navigate fields in builder
Shortcuts work only in form builder context
userStories.notes: Week 15. Productivity features for power users.

userStories.title: Loading States & Error Handling
acceptanceCriteria: Skeleton loaders for all major views
Optimistic UI updates for instant feedback
userStories.notes: Week 15. Polish for production-ready UX.

userStories.title: Performance Optimization
acceptanceCriteria: Database indexes on frequently queried columns (form_id, workspace_id, user_id)
Next.js image optimization (next/image) for all images
Lazy loading for form builder panels
Bundle size optimized (check with bundle analyzer)
userStories.notes: Week 15. Performance optimization for production.

userStories.title: Accessibility Compliance
acceptanceCriteria: Color contrast ratio 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text
Focus indicators visible on all elements
Skip to content link on all pages
ARIA labels where needed (icon buttons, etc.)
Form labels and error messages properly associated
Screen reader announces page changes and loading states
userStories.notes: Week 15. Accessibility audit and fixes.

userStories.title: Security Audit & Hardening
acceptanceCriteria: Input validation on all API endpoints
Secure file storage with signed URLs
Row-level security checks in all queries
userStories.notes: Week 15. Security hardening before launch.

userStories.title: Responsive Design & Cross-Browser Testing
acceptanceCriteria: Form builder responsive: single column on mobile, 2 panels on tablet, 3 panels on desktop
Form taking always full-screen and responsive
No console errors or warnings on any browser
userStories.notes: Week 15. Ensure cross-platform compatibility.

userStories.title: Testing - Unit & Integration Tests
acceptanceCriteria: Unit tests for validation functions in tests/unit/validations.test.ts
Unit tests for logic engine in tests/unit/logicEngine.test.ts
Unit tests for utilities and hooks (>80% coverage)
Integration tests for auth flows in tests/integration/auth.test.ts
Integration tests for forms CRUD in tests/integration/forms.test.ts
Integration tests for response submission in tests/integration/responses.test.ts
Jest configured with React Testing Library
userStories.notes: Week 16. Comprehensive test coverage.

userStories.title: Testing - End-to-End Tests
acceptanceCriteria: E2E test: Signup → Create workspace → Create form → Publish → Fill → View response
E2E test: Add logic jump → Test execution in form
E2E test: Invite team member → Accept invitation → Collaborate
E2E test: Configure theme → Apply to form → Verify on public page
E2E test: Set up webhook → Submit response → Verify webhook delivery
userStories.notes: Week 16. E2E tests for critical workflows.

userStories.title: Documentation - User & Developer Guides
acceptanceCriteria: Getting started guide for new users
userStories.notes: Week 16. Complete documentation for users and developers. Created docs/user-guide.md, docs/developer-guide.md, docs/api-reference.md, README.md, and CONTRIBUTING.md.

userStories.title: Production Deployment Setup
acceptanceCriteria: Vercel Blob or AWS S3 configured for file storage
OAuth credentials configured for production URLs
Production build successful with no errors
userStories.notes: Week 17. Production environment setup.

userStories.title: Monitoring, Analytics & CI/CD
acceptanceCriteria: Vercel Analytics or PostHog configured for user analytics
Error tracking working (test error logged successfully)
Analytics tracking user actions (form creation, submission)
Deploy to production on merge to main
userStories.notes: Week 17. Monitoring and CI/CD for production operations.

userStories.title: Load Testing & Launch Preparation
acceptanceCriteria: Load testing with 100+ concurrent form submissions
Load testing with 50+ concurrent form creations
Stress test response export with 1000+ responses
Database connection pool handles concurrent requests
Response times acceptable under load (< 500ms p95)
All features verified working in production
userStories.notes: Week 17. Final testing and launch preparation.

userStories.title: Production Launch
acceptanceCriteria: Application live and accessible at production URL
No critical bugs in first 24 hours
Support channel ready for user questions
userStories.notes: Week 17. Official launch of Typeform clone to production.
